user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count:
```c
int
mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count (void)
{
  int res;

#if defined(__linux__) || defined(__GLIBC__)
  /* On Linux kernel try first 'sched_getaffinity()' as it should be
     the native API.
     Also try it first on other kernels if Glibc is used. */
  res = mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_sched_getaffinity_ ();
  if (0 < res)
    return res;

  res = mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_cpuset_getaffinity_ ();
  if (0 < res)
    return res;
#else  /* ! __linux__ && ! __GLIBC__ */
  /* On non-Linux kernels 'cpuset_getaffinity()' could be the native API,
     while 'sched_getaffinity()' could be implemented in compatibility layer. */
  res = mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_cpuset_getaffinity_ ();
  if (0 < res)
    return res;

  res = mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_sched_getaffinity_ ();
  if (0 < res)
    return res;
#endif /* ! __linux__ && ! __GLIBC__ */

  res = mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_sched_getaffinity_np_ ();
  if (0 < res)
    return res;

  res = mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_w32_ ();
  if (0 < res)
    return res;

  return -1;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No occurrences of the Standard Library function memcmp are present in this code fragment. The snippet only performs integer assignments, integer comparisons (e.g. if (0 < res)), function calls, preprocessor conditional compilation and returns. There are no string operations or comparisons of null-terminated strings here, so no code in this fragment needs investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14. (Note: called functions such as mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_* are outside this snippet and would need to be inspected separately if available.)
